Comments: bytecode is CIL; .NET Core Runtime on GitHub
interactive web authoring tool. bytecode is named "ActionScript Byte Code (.abc)"

SLoC: 15k + 2850 per JIT arch + 500 per host OS

Comments: Features are simplified  usually include assembler  compiler  text-level and binary-level interpreters  sometimes editor  debugger and OS. Compiling speeds are >20 SKLOC/S and behave much like JIT.
SLoC: 2.8K to 5.6K; advanced  professional implementations are smaller.

Comments: Is an open-source virtual machine designed for executing programs written in Hack and PHP.

Base source code provides both the interpreter as well as an unsupported compile-to-C version. The runtime code  that is shared between the compiler and the interpreter  is written in a variant of C called RTT.
Implementation language: C  RTT (a custom front-end to C  provided with the base source for Icon).
SLoC: ~180k total. (source to bytecode: ~11k  bytecode interpreter: ~46k  iconc: ~23k  common/headers: ~13k  rtt: ~15k)

Languages: Java  Kotlin  Jython  Groovy  JRuby  C  C++  Clojure  Scala and several others
Comments: Reference implementation by Sun ; OpenJDK: code under GPL ; IcedTea: code and tools under GPL
Implementation language: JDK  OpenJDK & IcedTea with regular JIT : Java  C  ASM ; IcedTea with the "Zero" JIT : Java  C
SLoC: JVM is around 6500k lines; TCK is 80k tests and around 1000k lines

Languages: C  C++  Kotlin  Objective-C  Ada  Fortran  and Rust
Comments: MSIL  C and C++ output are supported. ActionScript Byte Code output is supported by Adobe Alchemy. bytecode is named "LLVM Bytecode (.bc)". assembly is named "LLVM Assembly Language (*.ll)".

Languages: CLI languages including: C#  VB.NET  IronPython  IronRuby  and others

Comments: UCSD Pascal  widespread in late 70s including Apple II

Languages: Perl (6 & 5)  NQP-rx  PIR  PASM  PBC  BASIC  bc  C99  ECMAScript  Lisp  Lua  m4  Tcl  WMLScript  XML  and others

Comments: Self-hosting implementation of Python  next generation of Psyco
Virtual machine for another Ruby implementation
A Micro-version of Microsoft .NET Framework to let applications run sandboxed inside browser
Self hosting implementation of Squeak virtual machine. Rich multi-media support.
Checking of memory accesses and leaks under Linux
Virtual machine for small devices  similar to Java
Virtual machine of the reference implementation for Ruby 1.9 and newer versions
